Comments_List: Review of some vocabulary and grammar. Readings and one novela, along with partner speaking/listening practice.
I learned quite a bit about learning languages, and how I learn best in a small classroom setting.

Strength is the immersion method of the class, weakness is that there was a lot of busywork that I just would do half-way. It would be better if there were fewer assignment, but more graded ones so I would have incentive to actually do the worksheets.
New activities and not the same, endless compositions and types of activities.

I think this was a fairly well designed course. I think the balance of work in the textbook and readings was very useful. The only thing I would change is some of the topics in the readings were sensitive, and some students would have reacted better if they had been warned of some potentially problematic themes or ideas.
I would, It felt like a strong well taught language course.
